answers.answer: Hi Lori1,You and I are in the same place right now, only I am 32.  I went in for a routine physical and my creatinine was 1.2.  Retest was 1.2.  I just did the 24 hour test and my GFR went from 52 to 65.  So that was good, I guess.  I have to have the GloFil test done because my neph is stumped.  I have no other symptoms either.All the doctors keep telling me not to worry which is easier said then done.  My internist also said that some people might just filter at that level and so there wouldn't be anything to worry about.Good luck and please keep me posted on what your neph. says.

question: Im a 37 year old very active and in shape woman.  Last week I had routine physical and the blood work said my kidney level was 1.2 then they retested at 1.13.  I followed up on a score from 2 years ago and it was .9.  I have no symptoms and feel great and in extremely good health otherwise.  My doctor has yet to follow up with me to answer any questions and ordered a 24 urine test.  I understand muscular individuals could have higher level, is this true and how much?  I have already scheduled an appointment with a nephrologist in 2 weeks but can you give my any opinion on these levels? Could this be normal? Are the test reliable? I also have no history in my family, no diabetes and low blood pressure.
title: Kidney Levels
